title: Match bytes and &str

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
I tried this code:

``` rust
#![feature(slice_patterns)]

fn main() {
    let buf = [0u8; 4];
    match &buf {
        &[0, 1, 0, 0] => (),
        b"true" => (),
        _ => ()
    }   

}

```

I expected to see this happen: 
I'm relatively new to rust, I tried to match a `&str` and `&[u8]` which seems to be the same type according to the doc :
http://doc.rust-lang.org/std/primitive.str.html#method.as_bytes

Instead, this happened:
The compiler panicked. I have maybe done something wrong but the compiler should not panicked for that.
